page.title: 17 Bury Remembered 1/2
page.content:
The pupils of St.John's spoke to one old lady born in 1914 in Paradise St. which is part of Peel Way now. Further up the street was a{blacksmiths. Before Peel way was built there was a pub and brewery called The Swan. There was also a rag & bone shop which used donkeys to collect the rags.
St. Joseph's Catholic School stood on Peter St. Whit walks used to take place then with the Catholics walking on Whit Sunday and the Protestants on Whit Friday to avoid fights.
I started work in the mill at 14 as a {weaver}.I worked from 7.45am to 5.30pm all week and Saturday mornings for 13/6d (67.5p). We did not get holiday pay. When you saw the doctor you could pay the bill at 6d (2.5p) per week. (cont 18)
